question: A 48-year-old female patient is brought to the emergency department with complaints of severe epigastric pain for 1 day, which became generalized and more severe for 3 hours. The pain is associated with vomiting, and she cannot tolerate even a liquid diet. She has a history of NSAID use for osteoarthritis for a long time. Her pulse is 120 beats/min, her blood pressure (BP) is 100/60 mmHg, she is afebrile, and her respiratory rate is 32 breaths/min. She has a tense tender abdomen with board-like rigidity. Gut sounds are inaudible. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 9-month-old female baby weighing 8 kg is brought to the emergency department with the complaint of loose motions for the last 3 days. On examination, the baby is irritable and her eyes are sunken. She is eager to drink and her skin pinch goes back slowly. What is the most likely diagnosis according to the IMNCI protocol?
Energy expenditure necessary to maintain basic physiologic function under standardized condition(s) is called:

A 32-year-old male patient, with a known case of Crohn’s disease, came to the outpatient department (OPD) with complaints of multiple discharging sinuses in the perianal region. What would be the most appropriate radiological investigation to reach the diagnosis in this patient?

A 35-year-old lady presented to the outpatient department (OPD) with intermittent diarrhea, fever, and on and off abdominal pain. Biopsy of this patient shows deep ulcers, marked lymphoid reaction, fibrosis, serositis, granuloma mass, and fistulas. Which of the following is the most likely possibility?

A 34-year-old man presents in the gastrointestinal (GI) clinic with abdominal pain, and jaundice. His laboratory investigation confirms that he is positive for hepatitis C infection. Which of the following is true of hepatitis C infection?

answers.option: Alpha-interferon is an effective treatment to cure the infection
Persistent infection and chronic hepatitis are the hall marks of the infection
Hepatitis C virus is a DNA virus

question: A 44-year-old man, an emergency medical technician, has felt fatigued for the past 4 months. On physical examination, there are no remarkable findings. Laboratory studies show his alanine transaminase (ALT) 132 U/L and aspartate transaminase (AST) 113 U/L with total bilirubin 1.3 mg/dL and direct bilirubin 0.8 mg/dL. A liver biopsy is performed, and microscopic examination shows focal necrosis, interface inflammation with the extension of inflammation into the lobules from the triads. There is a ground-glass appearance of hepatocytes. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most characteristic for his disease?

answers.option: Positive anti hepatitis B core antigen
Positive anti hepatitis B surface antigen

question: A 23-year-old male is brought to the emergency department with the complaint of pain in right lower abdomen for 5 days, which increases after eating. He has off and on diarrhea, with a history of weight loss for 3 months. He is also having intermittent fever for a few weeks. His pulse is 110 b/min, blood pressure (BP) is 100/70 mmHg and temperature is 100F. On examination, there is a tender palpable mass in the right iliac fossa absent bowel sounds. He also has two discharging fistulas in the peri-anal region. A complete blood picture was performed which depicts hemoglobin (Hb) of 8 gm/dl. What is the most likely cause of his condition?
Which of the following infection is associated with nasopharyngeal carcinoma?

A 50-year-old male with a history of ischemic heart disease presents with blood in the vomitus. There is no history of NSAIDs or steroid use. On examination, there is splenomegaly, ascites, and caput medusa around the umbilicus. Considering the diagnosis, what will be the best treatment option?

A 13-year-old child with a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus presents with intermittent diarrhea, abdominal pain, and vomiting. On examination, he has short stature with anemia, angular stomatitis, and paresthesia. What is the likely clinical diagnosis?

A 25-year-old male presents to the emergency with severe abdominal pain radiating to the back and left shoulder for 24 hours. He has a history of anorexia and vomiting for two days. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 26-year-old man suffered a heavy blow on the chin in boxing after which there was the escape of blood and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from the nose, and extravasation of blood in the orbit which manifested as a "black eye". Which type of fracture could have led to this?

answers.option: Fracture through the middle cranial fossa
Fracture through the posterior cranial fossa
Fracture through the anterior cranial fossa

question: A 26-year-old woman has had bloody, mucoid, low-volume diarrhea for the past six weeks. The stool frequency is five per day. She is afebrile, with no abdominal mass or tenderness. Stool examination reveals only mucous and blood with few leukocytes, no ova or parasites seen. Colonoscopy shows a friable, erythematous mucosa extending from the rectum to the middle of the descending colon. Rectal biopsy shows acute mucosal inflammation with cryptitis and crypt abscesses. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis?

A 28-year-old lady falls from a scooter and gets minor abrasions on the arm and forearm and bruising of the scalp. After reaching home, she has a quarrel with her husband, receives mild blows on the face, and later dies. Autopsy reveals 100 ml of blood beneath a fractured skull at the site of the bruise. What is the probable cause of death?

A 30-year-old girl ingested an unknown substance and died. A post-mortem was carried out to find the cause of death. The oral cavity showed a diffuse grayish-white escharotic appearance. Also, the gastrointestinal (GI) tract was inflamed but the cecum and large intestine showed intense inflammation along with gangrene. What do you think is the probable substance she ingested?

A 30-year-old man got hit on the vertex of the head that led to a fracture of the base of the skull. However, on examination, the bruise was found on the mastoid process behind the ears. What could be the reason for these positive findings of bruises on the mastoid processes?

A 30-year-old man met a road traffic accident, while he was riding a bike. The collision made his body drag on the road before he stopped by hitting a nearby tree. On examination, he was found to have superficial injuries involving only superficial layers of skin. What is the most probable injury he has sustained?

A 38-year-old man sitting on his terrace enjoying a cup of tea was suddenly hit on the head by a ricocheting glancing bullet that grazed his head and removed a part of the thickness of bone. What is this fracture called?

A 40-year-old man who worked in the dye finishing industry for 20 years comes in with complaints of colic & bluish-black lines on the gums. Complete blood count along with peripheral smear shows anemia along with punctate basophilia in red blood cells. In the light of positive findings, what is the most probable diagnosis?

A 43-year-old man complains of epigastric pain and nausea for 3 months. On physical examination, there are no abnormal findings. Upper GI endoscopy reveals a solitary sharply demarcated 2-cm shallow gastric ulcer at the antrum. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most relevant in this man?

A 50-year-old male presents with his investigations showing HBsAg positive, HBeAg negative, ALT 120 IU/ml, and HBV DNA >10,000 IU/ml. His fibro scan shows an F3 score. What is the best option to start with?
A 55-year-old male presents to the emergency room with fever, chills & rigors. He has right hypochondrial pain and jaundice. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 60-year-old male with small bowel diverticulosis presents with steatorrhea. He undergoes certain investigations including a hydrogen breath test which is positive. Which of the following condition should be considered in this case?
What is the state of complete emaciation called?

A young boy got hit during a fight by a baseball bat. It was a blunt injury with a perpendicular impact which resulted in a linear opening of the skin overlying the scalp. It resembled an incised wound. What is your most probable diagnosis of the type of injury he has sustained?

A young girl is attacked by thieves who badly injure her with knives. On examination, the wounds are present on her body and arm, clearly cut with no bruising at the wound edges. Gaping is also noted at the edges. In light of the above findings, what is the most probable diagnosis?
What is the most common site of diverticulitis?

A 29-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of recurrent abdominal pain for the last 1 year, mostly in the lower abdomen that is relieved by defecation. He is also giving the history of increased frequency of stools approximately 3-4 times per day. He does not have weight loss & nighttime awakening due to these symptoms. On examination, he is vitally stable. Systemic and general physical examinations are unremarkable. Complete blood count and ESR are normal. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 3-week-old male is referred for persistent vomiting. He was well until 5 days ago but is now vomiting with each feed and is not putting on weight. After a test feed, he has projectile non-bilious vomiting. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 39-year-old female comes to the outpatient department with abdominal pain. She has a history of weight loss and jaundice. Labs reveal raised alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) and des-gamma-carboxyprothrombin (DCP) levels. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A female patient comes to the clinic with complaints of diarrhea along with fever and abdominal cramping. Colonoscopy revealed pseudomembrane formation on colonic mucosa. The patient has a history of long-term intake of antibiotics. She still complains of repeated episodes of colitis. The doctor recommends fecal bacterio-therapy. Which one of the following bacteria is most probably involved?
Gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST) is associated with a mutation of?
The process of collecting, compiling, and publishing demographic, economic, and social data pertaining to a specific time from all persons of a country is called?
While examining a victim, the medicolegal officer writes a medicolegal certificate by mentioning a wound exposing bone without a fracture on the occipital area. How is this injury classified?
Which of the following represents the percentage of nitrogen that is retained in the body after absorption of diet?

answers.option: Biological value of only essential amino acids

question: Which of the following is used to treat a Helicobacter pylori infection?
Which of the following is a characteristic X-ray finding of jejunal obstruction?
Which of the following signs can help confirm appendicitis?
Which of the following is a side effect of ribavirin?

A 45-year-old man presents to the emergency room with wrist drop and foot drop. After evaluation, he is diagnosed with sideroblastic anemia. Which of the following enzymes is most likely to be affected in this patient?
A 38-year-old man presents to the emergency room with abdominal pain. On examination, the abdomen is soft and tender. An abdominal X-ray shows haustrations. Which part of the gut has haustrations?
On colonoscopy, a surgeon will differentiate the jejunum from ileum by which of the following?

A 2-month-old infant is brought from a rural area to the emergency room of a city hospital with fever, diarrhea, and vomiting. The stools are watery with frequent episodes. The child is given oral rehydration. The illness resolves without the administration of antibiotics. What is the most likely pathogen involved?
While circulating in the blood, copper largely binds to which of the following proteins?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding split laceration?

answers.option: It can occur on the forehead
It is a type of laceration
It occurs due to sudden compression between two hard objects
It looks like an incised wound
It can occur on the scrotal skin

question: A 29-year-old man presents to the outpatient department with complaints of abdominal distension, flatulence, and occasional diarrhea. He is diagnosed with Entamoeba histolytica infection and subsequently given an oral drug which is bioactivated by reduction of its nitro group by ferredoxin, which is present in parasites. What is the drug most likely to be?

A 29-year-old man presents to the outpatient department with complaints of abdominal distension, flatulence, and occasional diarrhea. He is diagnosed with Entamoeba histolytica infection. What is the treatment of choice?
Foods that have a low glycemic index are considered to be more beneficial because they cause less fluctuation in the secretion of a particular hormone. Which of the following is this hormone?

A 7-year-old boy presents to the emergency room with complaints of abdominal pain in the umbilical region which transfers to the right lower quadrant. According to the parents, the pain started 6 hours ago and did not subside. On examination, rebound tenderness is observed. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding a stab wound?

answers.option: It is a wedge shaped opening wound
It may occur with a knife
In this injury bruising around the opening of the wound is seen
It results from piercing with a pointed weapon

question: Blue-black lines in gum result from which of the following?
In gluconeogenesis which enzyme is primarily present in the liver?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding abrasion?

answers.option: Involves removal of superficial epithelial layer of the skin
It is caused by friction against a rough object
It leads to permanent scar formation

question: What is a wound defined as?

answers.option: Any injury with breach in natural continuity of skin or mucous membranes
The tearing or splitting of skin, mucous membranes, muscles or internal organs caused by either a shearing or a crushing force
The extravasation of blood in the subcutaneous/subepithelial tissues due to rupture of blood vessels
Penetration with long narrow, usually pointed, object that is deeper than its length and width
A clean cut wound through the tissues, which is more long than deep

question: What is a bruise defined as?

answers.option: The tearing or splitting of skin, mucous membranes, muscles or internal organs caused by either a shearing or a crushing force
The extravasation of blood in the subcutaneous/subepithelial tissues due to rupture of blood vessels
Penetration with long narrow, usually pointed, object that is deeper than its length and width
A clean cut wound through the tissues, which is more long than deep
Any injury with breach in natural continuity of skin or mucous membranes

question: What is laceration defined as?

answers.option: The tearing or splitting of skin, mucous membranes, muscles or internal organs caused by either a shearing or a crushing force
A clean cut wound through the tissues, which is more long than deep
The extravasation of blood in the subcutaneous/subepithelial tissues due to rupture of blood vessels
Penetration with long narrow, usually pointed, object that is deeper than its length and width
Any injury with breach in natural continuity of skin or mucous membranes

question: What is a stab wound defined as?

answers.option: Penetration with long narrow, usually pointed, object that is deeper than its length and width
Any injury with breach in natural continuity of skin or mucous membranes
The tearing or splitting of skin, mucous membranes, muscles or internal organs caused by either a shearing or a crushing force
The extravasation of blood in the subcutaneous/subepithelial tissues due to rupture of blood vessels
A clean cut wound through the tissues, which is more long than deep

question: What is an incision wound defined as?

answers.option: A clean cut wound through the tissues, which is more long than deep
Penetration with long narrow, usually pointed, object that is deeper than its length and width
The tearing or splitting of skin, mucous membranes, muscles or internal organs caused by either a shearing or a crushing force
Any injury with breach in natural continuity of skin or mucous membranes
The extravasation of blood in the subcutaneous/subepithelial tissues due to rupture of blood vessels

question: Which of the following is correct regarding age and color of a bruise?
Which of the following is correct regarding hepatorenal syndrome?

answers.option: Laboratory finding consistent with post-renal failure
Diagnosed when serum creatinine < 1.5 despite using diuretics

question: Ascites resulting from an increase in hydrostatic pressure occurs in which of the following?
A 5-day-old infant presented with diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal pain. Which of the following enzyme deficiencies is likely to cause this?
Which of the following is not a risk factor for hepatitis-induced encephalopathy?
A 41-year-old patient presents to the emergency with hyperreflexia. On examination, his GCS score is 12/15. Which of the following is the correct grade of encephalopathy?
Which of the following is not a side effect of interferon-alfa?
Which of the following stimulates gastric acid secretion?
Which of the following drugs acts through cell surface receptors increasing the activity of Janus kinase (JAK)?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding the pharmacokinetics of interferon-alfa?

answers.option: Elimination of IFN is mainly via proteolytic hydrolysis in the kidney
Absorption from intramuscular or subcutaneous injection is rapid
Conventional forms of IFN are usually administered daily or 3 times a week
There are several forms of IFN with minor differences in amino acid composition
Pegylated forms of IFN conjugated to polyethylene glycol can be administered once a week

question: Which drug should be added to the regimen of hepatitis C virus in the addition of interferon-alfa?
Which of the following represents the sex and age of a population?
What is a woman's physiological ability to bear and deliver children known as?
Which of the following is defined as the number of births per thousand of the midyear population in a year?
Which of the following is defined as the number of live births per thousand in an age group of a population?
Which of the following nonfunctional plasma enzymes is elevated in alcoholics?
A 2-year-old child with fever for which mother gave her paracetamol every 4 hours. Later he presented with upper quadrant pain and jaundice. Which of the following is the likely cause?

answers.option: Acute liver failure due to paracetamol poisoning

question: Transport of glucose across the basolateral membrane in intestinal cells occurs through which of the following?
A 68-year-old patient presents with abdominal pain, jaundice, and a history of weight loss. What is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Carcinoma of the tail and body of pancreas
Carcinoma of the head of pancreas
Obstruction of the main pancreatic duct

question: A patient is diagnosed with acute pancreatitis. Which of the following laboratory findings will not be seen?

A 31-year-old female presents to the emergency room with abdominal pain and diarrhea alternating with constipation. On stool analysis, a pale, foul-smelling stool is observed. She is advised to start a gluten-free diet. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the appropriate emergency surgery recommended for a patient with severe ulcerative colitis?

answers.option: Reserved proctocolectomy with ileal pouch-anal anastomosis

question: What is the mechanism of action of cisapride that increases gastrointestinal motility and is used to treat GERD?
Which of the following is a mechanism of action of sofosbuvir that is used in the treatment of the hepatitis C virus?
Which of the following is the characteristic radiological hallmark of paralytic ileus?
Which of the following combinations of drugs is used for the treatment of HCV-genotype 1?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the hepatitis C virus?
Which of the following antidiarrheal drugs can be given without a prescription?
Which of the following risk factors is most strongly associated with the development of fundic gland polyps?
Which of the following imaging techniques is useful in the diagnosis of pancreatic carcinoma?
Mutations of which of the following genes is not associated with the development of hereditary pancreatitis?
Which of the following genes is involved in sporadic colon carcinoma?

A 2-year-old child is brought to the emergency room with a history of loose stools for the past 3 days. On examination, the child is lethargic, has sunken eyes, and is unable to drink. What is the most appropriate treatment according to IMNCI?

answers.option: Intravenous Ringer's lactate 100 mg/Kg in 3 hours
Oral rehydration solution 75 ml/Kg in hours

question: Hepatic encephalopathy is a spectrum of disturbances in consciousness, ranging from subtle behavioral abnormalities to marked confusion and stupor, to deep coma and death. Which of the following is a useful indicator of its prognosis?
Which of the following nerves supplies the dermatome that is involved in referring the pain from the appendix to the umbilical region?
Which of the following antiemetic drugs is effective in increasing gastric motility and is used in patients with diabetic gastroparesis?
Which of the following antibiotics is effective in patients with shigella dysentery?

A 6-month-old boy presented to the clinic with a four hours history of crying and intermittent drawing up of his knees to his chest and was looking very pale. He had passed several currant jelly stools. On abdominal examination, there was a sausage-like mass in the right upper quadrant. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following drugs inhibits gastric acid secretion for about 18 hours?

A 65-year-old male presented to the clinic with a complaint of blood in the vomitus and a history of significant weight loss with ulcer-like symptoms. On upper GI endoscopy, there was a mass in the stomach. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A person presents to the emergency department with chronic diarrhea and abdominal pain for months. Findings show aphthous ulcers, deep linear fissures occupying the ascending and transverse colon but sparing the rectum and descending colon with skipped areas with excess fat creeping over mucosa. Cryptitis is also seen in lamina propria along with non-caseating granulomas. Which is the most probable diagnosis?

A 50-year-old man presents to the emergency room with severe abdominal pain referred to the upper back and left shoulder along with nausea and vomiting. Pain is not relieved by nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). He has a long history of alcohol abuse. The physician is suspecting acute pancreatitis. Which of the following findings is most likely to be present in the patient?

A 35-year-old female patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of abdominal discomfort for 3 months that was relieved on defecation. She also gave a history of changes in bowel habits with vitals completely normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
How do we diagnose irritable bowel syndrome?

answers.option: On the basis of clinical criteria

question: A hemodynamically unstable boy is brought to the emergency room with complaints of multiple fractured ribs on the left hypochondrium. Which of the following organs is most likely to be damaged?

Most of the potassium and sodium ions in the canaliculus of the parietal cells are reabsorbed into the cell cytoplasm, and another ion takes its place in the canaliculus. Which of the following ions is actively secreted in the canaliculus in exchange for potassium?

A 50-year-old truck driver presented to the outpatient department with the complaint of painful perianal swelling for a few months, which bursts on its own but recurs after some days and the wound never heals completely. On further investigation, he also gave a history of fever and pus discharge from the swelling. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a risk factor for cholangiocarcinoma?
Which of the following is a cause of bleeding in subdural hematoma?
Which of the following drugs is recommended for the quickest treatment for ulcers?

A 45-year-old male patient presented to the outpatient department with the complaint of bloody diarrhea with stingy mucoid material for 1 year. He also gave a history of lower abdominal cramps that were temporarily relieved by defecation. What is the gold standard test for confirming this disease?
Which of the following organisms would cause diarrhea in a patient with pseudomembranous colitis?
What are the official counting of a population in the territory of a country and the collection of information on selected demographic and socioeconomic characteristics of the population called?
A patient with a duodenal ulcer comes to the clinic with a complaint of blood in vomiting. The ulcer has eroded the posterior wall of the duodenum and ruptured which artery?
Which of the following arteries passes behind the first part of the duodenum?
Which of the following drugs is effective in NSAID-induced peptic ulcers?

A case of a road accident is presented to the emergency department in which the windshield was broken and the front seat passenger received injuries on the face from broken glass pieces. Which of the following types of injuries best describes this condition?
Which of these is closely related to the partially hydrogenated oils?
